Claude PRD: 11ty + Shopify + Google UCP

Complete Product Requirements Document for LLM implementation

Download PRD Download LLM Prompt

Document Overview

This Product Requirements Document provides comprehensive specifications for implementing an Eleventy (11ty) static site generator with Shopify Universal Commerce Protocol (UCP) and Google AI integration. The document is specifically designed for Claude (or other LLMs) to implement the complete system.

Executive Summary

Project Goal

Build a static e-commerce site using 11ty that fetches product data from Shopify's UCP Catalog API, implements OAuth 2.0 identity linking, processes payments via A2P (Agent Payments Protocol), and streams real-time data to Google AI for analytics and personalization.

Key Features

  • Static Site Generation: 11ty-based architecture for optimal performance
  • UCP Catalog Integration: Fetch products from Shopify's global catalog
  • OAuth 2.0 Identity: Secure user authentication and session management
  • A2P Payment Processing: Cryptographic payment mandates
  • Real-time Data Streaming: WebSocket connections to Google AI
  • Consent Management: GDPR-compliant user consent tracking

Technical Stack

yaml 
Frontend:
  - Eleventy (11ty) v3.x
  - Nunjucks templates
  - Vanilla JavaScript (ES6+)
  - CSS3 (BEM methodology)

Backend Services:
  - Shopify UCP Catalog API
  - OAuth 2.0 Identity Provider
  - A2P Payment Gateway
  - Google AI Data Stream API

Middleware:
  - Xano (optional)
  - n8n (optional)
  - WebSocket server

Data Flow:
  - REST APIs (Shopify UCP)
  - WebSocket (real-time streaming)
  - Server-Sent Events (notifications)

Implementation Phases

Phase 1: 11ty Setup & UCP Integration

  1. Initialize 11ty project with proper directory structure
  2. Configure data files to fetch from Shopify UCP Catalog API
  3. Create product listing and detail page templates
  4. Implement JWT authentication for API requests
  5. Add error handling and fallback content

Phase 2: OAuth 2.0 Identity Linking

  1. Implement OAuth 2.0 authorization code flow
  2. Create login/logout UI components
  3. Store session tokens securely (httpOnly cookies)
  4. Add session validation middleware
  5. Implement token refresh logic

Phase 3: A2P Payment Integration

  1. Generate cryptographic payment mandates
  2. Create checkout flow with A2P protocol
  3. Implement idempotency checks
  4. Add payment confirmation UI
  5. Handle payment webhooks

Phase 4: Google AI Data Streaming

  1. Set up WebSocket connection to Google AI
  2. Implement consent management UI
  3. Stream user behavior events (pageviews, clicks, purchases)
  4. Add real-time personalization based on AI responses
  5. Implement data retention policies

Success Metrics

Metric Target Measurement
Build Time < 30 seconds 11ty build duration
Page Load Speed < 2 seconds Lighthouse Performance score
API Response Time < 500ms UCP Catalog API latency
Payment Success Rate > 95% A2P transaction completion
WebSocket Uptime > 99.5% Connection stability

Security Requirements

  • Authentication: OAuth 2.0 with PKCE extension
  • Authorization: JWT tokens with short expiration (15 min)
  • Data Encryption: TLS 1.3 for all API communications
  • Payment Security: PCI DSS compliant A2P implementation
  • Consent Management: GDPR Article 7 compliance
  • Data Retention: User data deleted after 90 days of inactivity
